questions.question_text_1: The Head of the transportation facility at the IIT Madras campus wants to conduct a survey to rate the bus services offered to all the students. He randomly selects 100 final year students from the campus. Based on the given information, answer the subquestions
question_texts: The Head of the transportation facility at the IIT Madras campus wants to conduct a survey to rate the bus services offered to all the students. He randomly selects 100 final year students from the campus. Based on the given information, answer the subquestions

questions.question_text_1: Identify the sample and the population.
question_texts: Identify the sample and the population.

options.option_text: The population is all the students at IIT Madras campus.
The sample is all the final year students at IIT Madras campus.
The sample is 100 randomly selected final year students at IIT Madras campus.
The population is all the final year students at IIT Madras campus.

questions.question_text_1: Identify the correct statement from the following.
question_texts: Identify the correct statement from the following.

options.option_text: Selected sample is a good representation of the population.
Selected sample is not a good representation of the population.

questions.question_text_1: If a total of 500 fruits are sold on a given day, then find the number of mangoes sold.
question_texts: If a total of 500 fruits are sold on a given day, then find the number of mangoes sold.

questions.question_text_1: Choose the correct statement(s) from the following.
question_texts: Choose the correct statement(s) from the following.

options.option_text: The slices of pie chart adds up to 100%.
Median of the data is Grapes.
Mode of the data is Guava.
The pie chart is misleading because it does not obey the area principle.

questions.question_text_1: Calculate the absolute value of Point Bi-serial correlation coefficient between the result and number of hours spent. Enter the answer correct to three decimal places.
question_texts: Calculate the absolute value of Point Bi-serial correlation coefficient between the result and number of hours spent. Enter the answer correct to three decimal places.

questions.question_text_1: Are the exam results of the selected students strongly influenced by the number of hours spent studying?
question_texts: Are the exam results of the selected students strongly influenced by the number of hours spent studying?

options.option_text: Yes, because the absolute value of Point Bi-serial coefficient is close to 1.
No, because the absolute value of Point Bi-serial coefficient is close to 1.
Yes, because the absolute value of Point Bi-serial coefficient is close to 0.
No, because the absolute value of Point Bi-serial coefficient is close to 0.

questions.question_text_1: What is the average annual package of the students if each observation is doubled after subtracting 5 from it?
question_texts: What is the average annual package of the students if each observation is doubled after subtracting 5 from it?

questions.question_text_1: What is the population variance of the given data if 5 is subtracted from each observations?
question_texts: What is the population variance of the given data if 5 is subtracted from each observations?

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statement(s) is(are) true?
question_texts: Which of the following statement(s) is(are) true?

options.option_text: Eye colour of a person has ordinal scale of measurement.
Recording the price of bitcoin every hour for 3 days is a time-series data.
Number of students present in a class is a discrete variable.
Amount of milk (in litres) is a categorical variable.

questions.question_text_1: Sunidhi purchased 5 t-shirts of sizes M, L, S, XL, S for her cousins. Later she purchased one more t-shirt of size M, then choose the correct option(s) from the following:
question_texts: Sunidhi purchased 5 t-shirts of sizes M, L, S, XL, S for her cousins. Later she purchased one more t-shirt of size M, then choose the correct option(s) from the following:

options.option_text: Median of the new data is same as of old data.
New data will be bimodal.
Median of the new data will change.
New data will be unimodal.

questions.question_text_1: Find the IQR (Interquartile range) of the data 14, 20, 40, 23 and 18.
